content:
• Tuesday, August 27, 2019
  • MYT

    Urban Tea -8.2% on 10.7M-share filing by holders

    • Urban Tea (NASDAQ:MYT) has fallen 8.2% after hours after a shareholder filing to offer 10.67M shares.
    • The company won't receive any proceeds from the sale of shares.
    • Selling shareholders include 36 individuals, eight of whom have at least a 3% stake each.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • DOYU

    DouYu +1.9% as J.P. Morgan starts at Overweight

    • DouYu International Holdings (NASDAQ:DOYU) is up 1.9% after hours following an initiation by J.P. Morgan, at Overweight.
    • The firm set its price target on the ADRs at $13, implying 50% upside from last close.
    • Sell-side analysts rate DouYu at Buy on average, and Seeking Alpha authors are Bullish as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM | 6 Comments

  • LCI, IRS, PAHC and RLJ among after hour movers

    • Gainers: LCI +30.51%. IRS +12.97%. KOS +10.81%. CHRA +5.88%. FRAC +5%.
    • Losers: PAHC -24.96%. ADSK -11.28%. RLJ -5.2%. DGII -4.94%. PBYI -4.65%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • PAHC

    Phibro Animal Health FQ4 miss pressures shares, down 13% after hours

    • Phibro Animal Health (NASDAQ:PAHC) fiscal Q4 results:
    • Sales: $203.9M (-4%).
    • Net income: $8.8M (-60%); non-GAAP net income: $13.6M (-28%); EPS: $0.22 (-60%); non-GAAP EPS: $0.33 (-28%).
    • Non-GAAP EBITDA: $26.3M (-20%).
    • F2020 guidance: Sales growth: 1 - 5%; organic sales growth: 5 - 8%; non-GAAP EBITDA: $103M - 107M; non-GAAP net income: $44M - 46M; non-GAAP EPS: $1.08 - 1.14.
    • Shares down 13% after hours.
    • Previously: Phibro Animal EPS misses by $0.03, misses on revenue (Aug. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • LCI

    Lannett FQ4 sales down 22%; shares up 21% after hours on bullish guidance

    • Lannett Company (NYSE:LCI) fiscal Q4 results:
    • Net sales: $133.8M (-22%).
    • Non-GAAP net income: $14.7M (-40%); non-GAAP EPS: $0.37 (-42%).
    • Net loss: ($7.6M); loss/share: ($0.20).
    • Fiscal 2020 guidance: Sales: $525M - 545M; non-GAAP EBITDA: $145M - 160M.
    • Shares up 21% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 5 Comments
  • HPE

    HPE +6.8% as margins, profits rise in Q3

    • HP Enterprise (NYSE:HPE) is up 6.8% after hours following Q3 earnings that easily cleared profit expectations, matching the top-end estimates, and the company raised full-year profit guidance.
    • Revenues fell 7% to $7.22B, and missed consensus.
    • But gross margins rose 340 basis points to 33.9%, and non-GAAP EPS rose 7% to $0.45.
    • GAAP EPS of -$0.02 included a -$0.42/share adjustment for a one-time arbitration award to DXC.
    • Operating cash flow was $1.2B, and free cash flow was $648M.
    • Revenue by segment: Hybrid IT, $5.55B (down 9%); Intelligent Edge, $762M (down 3%); Financial Services, $888M (down 4%).
    • It's raising full-year guidance for non-GAAP EPS to $1.72-$1.76, above expectations for $1.68.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • VEEV

    Veeva +2.7% on raised FY view

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV) +2.7% on Q2 beats with 27% Y/Y revenue growth and $217.3M in subscription revenue, up 28%.
    • Q2 adjusted gross margin was 75.9% compared to the 74.5% estimate. Operating margin was 38.8% versus 35.5%.
    • Upside Q3 guidance has revenue of $274-275M (consensus: $268.35M) and EPS of $0.54-0.55 (consensus: $0.51).
    • The raised FY outlook sees revenue of $1.06-1.07B (was and consensus: $1.05B) and EPS of $2.11-2.13 (was: $2.01-2.03; consensus: $2.04).
    • CFO retirement: Tim Cabral will retire in 2020 after a decade with Veeva. The search for his replacement is underway, and Cabral will remain on through the hiring process for a smooth transition.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 5 Comments
  • LCI

    Lannett EPS beats by $0.16, beats on revenue

    • Lannett (NYSE:LCI): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.16; GAAP EPS of -$0.20 misses by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $133.84M (-21.7% Y/Y) beats by $13.56M.
    • Shares +18.57%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • HSY

    Hershey acquires ONE Brands

    • Hershey (NYSE:HSY) announces the acquisition of protein bar maker ONE Brands for $397M.
    • The company says ONE Brands will be a strong strategic fit within its overall innovative snacking powerhouse vision. The acquisition is expected to enable Hershey to provide a competitive offering of brands in the nutrition bar category.
    • The transaction will be financed with cash on hand as well as short-term borrowings.
    • The transaction is expected to close in Q4.
    • ONE Brands acquisition is expected to be slightly accretive to earnings in the first full year after closing.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 23 Comments
  • ADSK

    Autodesk -8.5% after beat-and-lower

    • Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) shares slide 8.5% after Q2 beats were offset by downside Q3 guidance and a FY outlook cut.
    • Q2 annualized recurring revenue grew 31% Y/Y to $3.07B. Billings increased 48% to $893M.
    • The Q3 outlook has revenue of $820-830M (consensus: $838.4M) and EPS of $0.70-0.74 (consensus: $0.78).
    • The FY view drops to revenue of $3.24-3.27B (was: $3.25-3.3B; consensus: $3.28B) and EPS of $2.69-2.81 (was: $2.71-2.90; consensus: $2.83).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 15 Comments
  • HPE

    Hewlett Packard Enterprise EPS beats by $0.05, misses on revenue

    • Hewlett Packard Enterprise (NYSE:HPE): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.05; GAAP EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $7.22B (-7.0% Y/Y) misses by $70M.
    • Shares +5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • SSNT

    SilverSun up 42% on asset sale

    • Ultra-thinly traded nano cap SilverSun Technologies (SSNT +41.5%) is up a whopping 470x surge in volume after announcing that subsidiary SWK Technologies sold its MAPADOC EDI division to SPS Commerce for $11.5M in cash.
    • Shares peaked at $8.25 intraday before retracing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • ARGT

    Argentina reserve sales exceed IMF limit; ARGT falls 1.9%

    • Global X MSCI Argentina ETF (NYSEARCA:ARGT) falls 1.9% after Argentina exceeded for the first time a guideline on reserve sales that were included in a $57B standby agreement with the International Monetary Fund.
    • The nation sold $302M in the foreign exchange market, traders told Reuters, exceeding the $250M limit on daily reserve sales in the agreement, which was set when the exchange rate was above 51.5 pesos per dollar.
    • The Argentinian peso is down 1.6% at about 56.23 pesos per greenback.
    • Argentina's central bank has sold more than $1B in its own reserves to support the currency amid political uncertainty triggered by the left-wing opposition's victory in a primary vote this month for October's presidential election.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 1 Comment

  • Microcaps top tech movers

    • Gainers: SilverSun Technologies (NASDAQ:SSNT) +49%.  Bitauto Holdings Limited (NYSE:BITA) +12%.  Powerbridge Technologies (NASDAQ:PBTS) +11%.  Pintec Technology Holdings Limited (NASDAQ:PT) +9%.  SPI Energy (NASDAQ:SPI) +8%.
    • Losers: Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) -17%. DPW Holdings (NYSEMKT:DPW) -13%. Super League Gaming (NASDAQ:SLGG) -11%. GTT Communications (NYSE:GTT) -9%. Evolent Health (NYSE:EVH) -9%.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • GLD

    Gold, silver surge to multi-year highs as safe-haven trade returns

    • Gold futures (GLD +0.7%) pushed to their highest settlement in nearly six-and-a-half years and silver jumped to a more than two-year high, as safe-haven demand kicks into high gear.
    • December Comex gold settled +1% to $1,551.80/oz., the highest finish for a most-active contract since April 2013, and September silver surged +2.9% to $18.153/oz., the highest for a most-active contract since April 2017.
    • Precious metals prices enjoyed a boost as losses mounted in the U.S. stock market, Treasury bond yields and the dollar.
    • Pres. Trump's talk of a deal with China may be just "rhetoric from the White House as opposed to an actual fact pointing to negotiation," says Bart Melek, head of commodity strategies at TD Securities in Toronto, adding "When gold does really well and gets quite expensive, investors on the margin will move into silver... not a big surprise that silver is doing well."
    • Gold and silver stocks easily outperform the broader market, and the Global X Silver Miners ETF (SIL +3.8%) and Silver Trust ETF (SLV +2.8%) each trade at better than 52-week highs.
    • Among today's gainers: GOLD +2.5%, NEM +3.6%, KGC +3.6%, AU +4%, AUY +3.1%, KL +4.2%, HMY +5.2%, AGI +3%, EGO +2.3%, BTG +4.5%, IAG +6.8%, NG +4.6%, WPM +2.5%, PAAS +6.6%.
    • Other ETFs include: GDX, NUGT, GDXJ, JNUG, GGN, DUST, IAU, AGQ, PSLV, PHYS, USLV, JDST, SIVR, SGOL, GOEX, UGLD, ZSL, SGDM, UGL
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 86 Comments

  • Snap -4.5% as Instagram tests close-friends app

    • A Snap (SNAP -4.5%) decline today is outpacing the market doldrums amid concern that a new Instagram (FB +0.8%) app could horn in on its territory.
    • Facebook is building an Instagram companion messaging app called Threads meant to share more details with fewer people: The app can automatically share location, speed and battery life with a small set of close friends, along with the usual text, photos and videos.
    • The goal is constant, automatic sharing among a small set of people.
    • The company is testing Threads internally and hopes it can achieve the in-app engagement numbers that Snap has become used to.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 28 Comments

  • Barclays turns bearish on Anheuser-Busch InBev

    • Barclays drops Anheuser-Busch InBev (BUD -1.9%) to an Underweight rating from Equal-weight due to what the firm's calls as structural decline in the U.S. and ongoing pressure in South Africa and South America.
    • The firm is fading most of the rest of the sell-side, which has a consensus Outperform rating on BUD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 2 Comments

  • Ossen Innovation and Alexco Resource among Energy/Materials gainers; Yuma Energy and Rosehill Resources among losers

    • Gainers: Ossen Innovation (NASDAQ:OSN) +35%. Alexco Resource (NYSEMKT:AXU) +14%. Quintana Energy Services (NYSE:QES) +12%. Coeur Mining (NYSE:CDE) +10%. CARBO Ceramics (NYSE:CRR) +10%.
    • Losers: Yuma Energy (NYSEMKT:YUMA) -10%. Rosehill Resources (NASDAQ:ROSE) -9%. Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) -8%. Tellurian (NASDAQ:TELL) -8%. SAExploration (NASDAQ:SAEX) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • KBE

    Financials wilt as Treasurys rally

    • It's not surprising. When bonds rally, yields decline and financials sink. And the more-pronounced inverted yield curve puts nerves more on edge.
    • The SPDR S&P Bank ETF (NYSEARCA:KBE) falls 1.5%; for the past six months, it's slumped 11% compared with a 3.0% increase for the S&P 500.
    • The six biggest U.S. banks are all in the red: Bank of America (BAC -1.4%), Citigroup (C -2%), JPMorgan Chase (JPM -1.2%), Wells Fargo (WFC -0.3%), Goldman Sachs (GS -0.9%), and Morgan Stanley (MS -1%).
    • Regional banks aren't any better. The SPDR S&P Regional Banking ETF slides 1.3%, losing 13% in the past six months.
    • Among the biggest losers in that category: Bank OZK (OZK -2.8%), CIT Group (CIT -1.9%), Axos Financial (AX -1.5%), and Comerica (CMA -1.3%).
    • There are a few bright spots in non-U.S.-based multinational banks -- Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS +1.3%), ICICI Bank (IBN +1.8%), LLoyds Banking Group (LYG +0.2%), and Deutsche Bank (DB +0.7%).
    • Credit companies are especially hard-hit: American Express (AXP -0.9%), Synchrony Financial (SYF -1.2%), Capital One (COF -1.5%), Discover Financial (DFS -0.8%), and Alliance Data Systems (ADS -3.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 34 Comments
  • MAXR

    Maxar seals four-year deal with U.S. agency

    • Maxar Technologies (MAXR -5.2%) has won a new four-year deal with the U.S. National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency for the Global Enhanced GEOINT Delivery program.
    • That deal's valued at $44M for the base year and for each of three option years at the same value.
    • That will provide U.S. government users with access to a 100-petabyte library of historical imagery as well as daily collections.
    • The deal's set to commence Sept. 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 5 Comments
  • JNJ

    Opioid-related stocks under pressure on perceived financial risk after J&J verdict

    • Opioid-related companies are not enjoying any of buying in Johnson & Johnson (JNJ +1.8%) after an Oklahoma judge fined it $572M over its role in the opioid epidemic there, a ruling that it intends to appeal. Whatever the final amount is, the company has ample resources to pay it as well as future amounts from pending lawsuits.
    • Others with less robust cash reserves may be under more pressure as the cases wind through the courts.
    • Selected tickers: AmerisourceBergen (ABC -4.4%), McKesson (MCK -4.5%), Cardinal Health (CAH -4.1%), Mallinckrodt (MNK -12.3%), Endo International (ENDP -6.9%), Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA -6.7%)
    • Update: Adding to the downward pressure is the news that Oxycontin maker Purdue Pharma and the controlling Sackler family have apparently offered to pay $10B - 12B to settle all remaining opioid-related lawsuits.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 189 Comments

  • Standex International only industrial gainer; Manitowoc and Ocean Power Technologies among losers

    • Gainers: Standex International (NYSE:SXI) +24%.
    • Losers: Charah Solutions (NYSE:CHRA) -9%. Cemtrex (NASDAQ:CETX) -9%. ClearSign Combustion (NASDAQ:CLIR) -8%. The Manitowoc Company (NYSE:MTW) -8%. Ocean Power Technologies (NASDAQ:OPTT) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • MOSY

    MoSys +8% ahead of 1-for-20 reverse split

    • MoSys (NASDAQ:MOSY) announces a reverse stock split, effective when the market opens tomorrow.
    • The split is intended to increase the per share trading price to meet the Nasdaq's $1 minimum bid price listing requirement.
    • MOSY shares are up 8% to $0.14.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM

  • Jupai Holdings the only financial gainer, Grupo Supervielle leads losers

    • Gainers: Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +7%.
    • Losers: Grupo Supervielle (NYSE:SUPV) -10%. MDJM (NASDAQ:MDJH) -9%. Vista Oil & Gas (NYSE:VIST) -9%. IRSA Inversiones (NYSE:IRS) -8%. Ladenburg Thalmann Financial Services (NYSEMKT:LTS) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM

  • Partner Communications +2.4% as profits grow in Q2

    • Partner Communications (NASDAQ:PTNR) is up 2.4% after posting its Q2 results featuring a growth in profit and EBITDA with service revenues increasing.
    • Total revenues fell 2%, to 781M shekels (about $219M). But service revenues grew 4% to 642M shekels, partly offsetting a 21% decline in equipment sales.
    • Meanwhile operating expenses dropped 4% to 472M shekels, and profits rose 50% to 3M shekels.
    • The cellular subscriber base is essentially flat at 2.62M, while TV subscriber base is up 77,000 to 160,000. Cellular churn dropped to an eight-year low of 7.9%.
    • Adjusted free cash flow fell 24M shekels to 31M.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Earnings call transcript
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM

  • Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Ossen Innovation (NASDAQ:OSN) +41%. Sears Hometown and Outlet Stores (NASDAQ:SHOS) +27%. Koss (NASDAQ:KOSS) +25%. Standex International (NYSE:SXI) +24%. Caleres (NYSE:CAL) +23%. Prothena Corporation (NASDAQ:PRTA) +23%. Town Sports International Holdings (NASDAQ:CLUB) +22%. Nuvectra (NASDAQ:NVTR) +20%. Kaixin Auto (NASDAQ:KXIN) +19%. Avadel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AVDL) +15%.
    • Losers: Appliance Recycling Centers of America (NASDAQ:ARCI) -32%. Constellation Alpha Capital (NASDAQ:CNAC) -22%. Modern Media Acquisition (NASDAQ:MMDM) -22%. J.Jill (NYSE:JILL) -18%. Chico's FAS (NYSE:CHS) -18%. Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) -18%. LAIX (NYSE:LAIX) -17%. Arcadia Biosciences (NASDAQ:RKDA) -16%. Emmaus Life Sciences (NASDAQ:EMMA) -15%. Mallinckrodt (NYSE:MNK) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM

  • Tata Motors and Caleres among consumer gainers; The J. M. Smucker among losers

    • Gainers: Koss (NASDAQ:KOSS) +26%. Caleres (NYSE:CAL) +25%. Trinseo (NYSE:TSE) +9%. Myers Industries (NYSE:MYE) +8%. Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) +8%.
    • Losers: KBS Fashion (NASDAQ:KBSF) -10%. The J. M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) -9%. Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) -9%. Niu Technologies (NASDAQ:NIU) -9%. Farmer Bros. (NASDAQ:FARM) -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • VJET

    Voxeljet receives NYSE noncompliance notice

    • Voxeljet (VJET -0.4%) received the notice on August 23 for failing to have an average global market cap of $50M for a consecutive 30 trading-day period.
    • VJET shareholders' equity was also less than $50M for the period.
    • VJET's actual figures came in at $43.3M market cap and $45.4M equity.
    • The company will notify the NYSE within 30 days that it will file a compliance plan within 90 days.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 4 Comments
  • EPIX

    ESSA Pharma closes $36M capital raise

    • ESSA Pharma (EPIX -2.9%) has closed its "best efforts" public offering of 18M common shares at $2 per share. Gross proceeds were $36M. The company says its topped-up resources should be sufficient to fund operations through 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM

  • Investors size up Philip Morris-Altria development

    • Philip Morris (PM -9.1%) would have an ownership stake of 58% in the new company if a merger with Altria (MO +6%) is finalized, sources tell Bloomberg.
    • The deal is expected to go off without a premium to the share prices last Friday. The goal would be to close the transaction within six months.
    • Wells Fargo, fresh off reading the tea leaves correctly yesterday, says it sees significant value creation for Altria and Philip Morris shareholders.
    • Analyst Bonnie Herzog notes a merger would create the leading global nicotine company given the benefits of scale in light of the increasing importance of global integration in the current global "arms" race for reduced ­risk products and increased regulatory risks in the U.S. for vaping/nicotine levels. Cash flow benefits and geographic diversification are two other major positives.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 288 Comments
  • LAIX

    LAIX -14.9% after Q2 headwinds

    • LAIX (NYSE:LAIX) shares drop 14.9% after the Q2 revenue miss with management citing the tightened WeChat moments sharing policy and increased customer acquisition costs due to competitive pressure.
    • The company is adjusting its marketing strategy and "actively exploring alternative marketing channels."
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM

  • Prothena leads healthcare gainers; Mallinckrodt and Endo International among losers

    • Gainers: Prothena (NASDAQ:PRTA) +28%. Nuvectra (NASDAQ:NVTR) +18%. Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BLCM) +13%. T2 Biosystems (NASDAQ:TTOO) +12%. Plus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PSTV) +9%.
    • Losers: Emmaus Life Sciences (NASDAQ:EMMA) -15%. Mallinckrodt (NYSE:MNK) -10%. Endo International (NASDAQ:ENDP) -8%. Zai Lab (NASDAQ:ZLAB) -7%. Amneal Pharmaceuticals (NYSE:AMRX) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • DMPI

    DelMar Pharma down 12% after trial update

    • Nano cap DelMar Pharmaceuticals (DMPI -12.3%) slumps on what appears to be average volume after announcing that its current cash resources should be sufficient to enable complete enrollment in its two ongoing Phase 2 clinical trials evaluating lead candidate VAL-083 in patients with glioblastoma multiforme (GBM), expected to happen by Q4 2020. Investors appear to have been expecting a shorter timeline or longer cash runway.
    • The company will update on the studies, one in China and one in the U.S., at the Society of Neuro-Oncology meeting in November and at ASCO in May 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DCIX

    Performance Shipping sells Panamax container vessel, the M/V Pamina

    • Performance Shipping (DCIX +4.6%) announced it has signed a Memorandum of Agreement to sell to an unaffiliated third party the 2005-built vessel “Pamina”, with delivery latest by November 15, 2019, for a sale price of $9.125M before commissions.
    • Performance Shipping’s fleet will now consist of 3 container vessels (2 Post-Panamax and 1 Panamax) and one Aframax tanker vessel.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    Activision +6% after 'WoW Classic' launch

    • Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) has launched World of Warcraft Classic, a throwback to the venerable game's origins, on its 15th anniversary.
    • The game is a re-creation of its pre-expansion mode at its most feature-complete -- as of the 2006 "Drums of War" update. The game has since gone through seven expansions.
    • It's now among the top channels on Twitch.
    • Shares are up a sharp 6% to $51.63, and touched their highest point since the end of November.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 47 Comments
  • MAKSF

    Marks & Spencer likely to exit FTSE 100

    • U.K. retailer Marks & Spencer (OTCQX:MAKSF) could get dropped from the FTSE 100 after being a component for 35 years, according to The Telegraph.
    • An upcoming FTSE 100 review will be based on closing prices on September 3.
    • Shares of M&S are down 10% over the last 90 days, putting the stock in danger of the FTSE 100 boot.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM

  • GRUB deepens Applebee's, IHOP partnership

    • GrubHub (GRUB -0.1%) expands its partnership with Dine Brands (DIN -2.5%), owner of Applebee's and IHOP.
    • The expansion will nearly triple the number of locations available on the GRUB marketplace, bringing the total to around 3,000 restaurants.
    • The partners will also work on a direct-to-POS integration for menu syncing and order submission.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • CRTO

    Criteo announces MoPub conversion rate

    • Criteo (CRTO +0.6%) says total conversions for CRTO advertisers on MoPub inventory increased 90% Y/Y in Q2.
    • Twitter-owned MoPub provides monetization solutions for mobile app publishers and developers. Criteo recently launched of in-app native ads with MoPub.
    • In the coming months, Criteo plans to add more MoPub formats for real-time advertiser bidding, including video.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM

  • Food stocks crumble after weak earnings

    • Food stocks are getting hit after J.M. Smucker (SJM -9.7%) disappointed with FQ1 earnings. A large drop in coffee margins and weak peanut butter pricing stood out from SJM's report.
    • Lancaster Colony (NASDAQ:LANC) tops the list with a drop of 6.19% after soft earnings of its own. Other notable decliners include General Mills (GIS -3.1%), SunOpta (STKL -1.7%), Campbell Soup (CPB -1.6%), ConAgra Brands (CAG -1.6%), Ingredion (INGR -1.3%) and Kellogg (K -1.4%).
    • Kraft Heinz (KHC -1.5%) is also retreating and is only $0.32 from its 52-week low.
    • Related ETF: PBJ.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 40 Comments
  • EXC

    Exelon upgraded at Morgan Stanley as stock pricing in no merchant value

    • Exelon (EXC +1.9%) pops in early trade after Morgan Stanley upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $60 price target.
    • After backing out the utility, EXC shares price in no value for its 32 GW unregulated merchant fleet, which generates strong free cash flow, or legislation in Illinois, which could add $4/share, says Stanley analyst Stephen Byrd.
    • The market is mispricing EXC's merchant generation business, ExGen, according to Byrd, who also believes the stock's YTD underperformance relative to peers is overdone and provides a good entry point.
    • EXC's average Sell Side Rating is Outperform, while both its Seeking Alpha Authors Rating and Quant Rating are Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 6 Comments
  • TECD

    Tech Data -2% as Citi sees risks

    • Citi maintains a Neutral rating on Tech Data (NASDAQ:TECD) but cuts the target from $100 to $91 and adds the company to the Negative Catalyst watch list.
    • The firm sees risks ahead of the earnings report due to top vendor softness, European exposure, and operating income guidance that's heavily loaded to the back end.
    • TECD will report earnings pre-market on August 29.
    • Tech Data shares are down 2% to $84.24. The company had a Hold average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNK

    Mallinckrodt down 9% after losing appeal in Inomax patent dispute

    • Mallinckrodt (MNK -8.8%) is down in early trade in response to an appeals court ruling in favor of Praxair (LIN +0.6%) that the latter's inhaled nitric oxide, branded as Noxivent, does not infringe on MNK's INOmax (nitric oxide) patents.

  • AMRN

    Amarin up 1% premarket on continued market acceptance of Vascepa and REDUCE-IT data

    • In an update, Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) lists certain events and publications demonstrating the medical community's "growing interest" in using Vascepa (icosapent ethyl) in patients at risk of a cardiovascular event and the data generated in the REDUCE-IT study. Two key developments in terms of standards of care:
    • On August 19, the American Heart Association issued a scientific advisory stating that elevated triglycerides may be a causal factor for cardiovascular disease and that dietary supplements are not approved nor recommended to treat medical conditions. Vascepa is the only drug listed in the advisory.
    • Earlier this year, the American Diabetes Association updated its standards of care guidelines based on REDUCE-IT data, recommending that icosapent ethyl "be considered for diabetics with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease or other cardiac risk factors on a statin with controlled low-density cholesterol (LDL-C), but with elevated triglycerides (135-499) to reduce cardiovascular risk."
    • Shares are up 1% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 41 Comments

  • SJM

    J.M. Smucker -3% after soft quarter

    • J.M. Smucker (NYSE:SJM) says its Q1 performance fell short of expectations primarily due to the timing of shipments and deflationary pricing in the coffee and peanut butter categories, as well as competitive activity in the premium dog food category.
    • Sales were down 6% during the quarter to $1.78B after lower volume/mix reduced sales by 3 percentage points. Declines for private label pet food offerings and coffee factored into the sales drop. Net price realization reduced net sales by 1 percentage point, mostly due to lower pricing for coffee and peanut butter, partially offset by higher pricing for pet food and snacks. Foreign currency exchange was neutral.
    • Gross margin arrived at 39.3% of sales vs. 35.6% a year ago.
    • Adjusted operating income was down 8.3% to $291M.
    • Looking ahead, the food company anticipates full-year EPS of $8.35 to $8.55 vs. $8.45 to $8.65 prior and $8.45 consensus.
